alert.note: Alert for Southern Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 24 at 2:12PM MDT until July 25 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS EVENING AND TOMORROW AFTERNOON... .Gusty southwest winds will increase across Southwest Idaho and Southeast Oregon, especially near the Nevada border and on ridgetops, during the afternoon and evening hours with very low relative humidity. This will result in critical fire weather conditions. The strongest winds will arrive this afternoon and evening ahead of a cold front. After the cold front passage this evening, winds will decrease substantially on Tuesday in southeast Oregon but will remain elevated in southwest Idaho especially near the ID-NV border in zones 426 and 423. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS... WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 426... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. * WINDS...West 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity values of 10 to 15 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.
